## API POST to Link Records
http://localhost:8080/api/v2/tables/{tableId}/links/{linkFieldId}/records/{recordId}

## NocoDB Data API
https://data-apis-v2.nocodb.com/#tag/Table-Records/operation/db-data-table-row-nested-list

## NocoDB Meta API
https://meta-apis-v2.nocodb.com/

This is the table you are linking to â€” the "destination"

#### Example I Show:
ONE Video Production (Target) is linked to MANY Scenes (Source)

#### Many to Many - Target and Source are insignificant
Example:  MANY Video Productions have MANY Scenes - i.e. You can use scenes in various productions, and you want to keep records where those scenes are being used"},"typeVersion":1},{"id":"6adaeec0-ab7b-4dca-8147-0801f0a215f8","name":"Sticky Note2","type":"n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote","position":[600,-120],"parameters":{"width":220,"height":280,"content":"### Source Table (Many)

"},"typeVersion":1},{"id":"8c028f2f-840c-4287-b6cc-fc6123eff6a7","name":"Sticky Note3","type":"n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote","position":[1340,-140],"parameters":{"color":3,"width":440,"height":440,"content":"## In Other Words

POST:
https://<YOUR NOCODB URL -- see 'Set Variables' node>/api/v2/tables/<TARGET TABLE ID -- see 'Set Variables' node>/links/<TARGET TABLE COLUMN ID -- see 'Get Target Table Meta Data' node>/records/<TARGET TABLE RECORD ID -- see 'Get Target Table Row' node, 'Formula' Column using RECORD_ID()>

BODY (single record):
[ { "Id": <SOURCE TABLE RECORD ID -- see 'Get Source Table Row' node, 'Formula' Column using RECORD_ID()> } ]

BODY (many records from source):
[
  { "Id": <1st Record ID> },
  { "Id": <2nd Record ID> },
  ...{ "Id": <X Record IDs> },...
  { "Id": <Last Record ID> }
]

readme:
**How it works:**  
The n8n flow grabs the needed IDs, fetches the current links, adds your new one, and sends a single HTTP request to NocoDB to update the recordâ€™s linked entries.

**Set up steps:**

  * Plan for 10 minutes setup if youâ€™re already running n8n and NocoDB.
  * Youâ€™ll need to copy/paste table IDs, set up your HTTP node, and test once.
  * No coding, just copy IDs.
